result.execSummary:
The defendant James H. Massey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James H. Massey

records.addlTxt: 3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James H. Massey not in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for James H. Massey. State moves to amend to an ordianance. Granted. Svehlek enters guilty plea. Court issues fine of $421.00. adj. 03:10 PM

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
3:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James H. Massey in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for James H. Massey. Prosecuting attorney In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Bail continued. adj. 03:17 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James H. Massey in court. Court review of case. Court question Defendant on counsel. Defendant states will be represented by PD - has not been appointed yet. adj. 03:26 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant James H. Massey appeared in court. Court review of case - Defendant not eligible for PD/court appointed counsel - will set out. Bond continued. adj. 03:30 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant James H. Massey appeared in court. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schjiek statement to bail. Defendant statement to counsel. Court explains on how to apply to PD/Court appointed counsel. Court sets bond. adj. 02:33 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - Declined
